dataclasses/columns.js

  1. const { mergeAll, trim } = require('ramda');
  2. const $_type = require('./$_type');
  4. /**
  5.  * Target type definition
  6.  * @typedef {Object} Target
  7.  * @memberof dataclasses
  8.  */
  10. /**
  11.  * Create a new target
  12.  * @param {object} target target
  13.  * @param {string} target.target_id - unique id for this target
  14.  * @param {string} target.label - label that will be displayed for this target
  15.  * @param {string} target.type_id - the type_id name this target has
  16.  * @return {Target} {@link dataclasses.Target}
  17.  * @memberof dataclasses
  18.  */
  19. function Target(target) {
  20.   const { target_id, label, type_id } = _requireProps(
  21.     target,
  22.     'target_id,label,type_id'
  23.   );
  24.   // target MUST at least have the attributes bellow
  25.   return mergeAll([$_type('Target'), { target_id, label, type_id }, target]);
  26. }
  28. /**
  29.  * @param  {Target} target target
  30.  * @return {Object} JSON serializable object
  31.  */
  32. Target.toJSON = function(target) {
  33.   return {
  34.     target_id: target.target_id,
  35.   };
  36. };
  38. /**
  39.  * A type operator
  40.  * @typedef Operator
  41.  * @memberof dataclasses
  42.  */
  44. /**
  45.  * Create a new operator
  46.  * @param {object} operator operator
  47.  * @param {string} operator.operator_id - unique id for this operator
  48.  * @param {string} operator.argumentType_id - the argumentType associated with the operator. For example to define a "is" operator and associate it with two targets "article publishing date" and "article title" then we would have to define 2 operators because ["article publishing date" "is"] and  ["article title" "is"] do NOT have the same kind of arguments (one is a date the other is a string) and associated UI components (one is a date picker the other is a text input)
  49.  * @param {string} operator.label - label that will be displayed for this operator
  50.  * @return {Operator} {@link dataclasses.Operator}
  51.  * @memberof dataclasses
  52.  */
  53. function Operator(operator) {
  54.   // operator MUST at least have the properties bellow
  55.   const { operator_id, label, argumentType_id } = _requireProps(
  56.     operator,
  57.     'operator_id,label,argumentType_id'
  58.   );
  59.   return mergeAll([
  60.     $_type('Operator'),
  61.     {
  62.       operator_id,
  63.       argumentType_id,
  64.       label,
  65.     },
  66.     operator,
  67.   ]);
  68. }
  70. /**
  71.  * @param  {Operator} operator operator
  72.  * @return {Object} JSON serializable object
  73.  */
  74. Operator.toJSON = function(operator) {
  75.   return {
  76.     operator_id: operator.operator_id,
  77.   };
  78. };
  80. /**
  81.  * Defines a target type
  82.  * @typedef Type
  83.  * @memberof dataclasses
  84.  */
  86. /**
  87.  * Create a new type
  88.  * @param {Object} type type
  89.  * @param {string} type.type_id type_id
  90.  * @param {string[]} type.operator_ids array of operator_id
  91.  * @return {Type} {@link dataclasses.Type}
  92.  * @memberof dataclasses
  93.  */
  94. function Type(type) {
  95.   // type MUST at least have the properties bellow
  96.   const { type_id, operator_ids } = _requireProps(type, 'type_id,operator_ids');
  97.   return mergeAll([
  98.     $_type('Type'),
  99.     {
  100.       type_id,
  101.       operator_ids,
  102.     },
  103.     type,
  104.   ]);
  105. }
  107. /**
  108.  * Create a new type logical type
  109.  * Logical types or used in CompoundPredicates
  110.  * @param {Object} logicalType The predicate logic
  111.  * @param {string} logicalType.logicalType_id logicalType_id
  112.  * @param {string} logicalType.label label
  113.  * @return {object} logicalType object
  114.  * @memberof dataclasses
  115.  */
  116. function LogicalType(logicalType) {
  117.   // logicalType MUST at least have the properties bellow
  118.   const { logicalType_id, label } = _requireProps(
  119.     logicalType,
  120.     'logicalType_id,label'
  121.   );
  122.   return mergeAll([
  123.     $_type('LogicalType'),
  124.     {
  125.       logicalType_id,
  126.       label,
  127.     },
  128.     logicalType,
  129.   ]);
  130. }
  132. /**
  133.  * @param  {LogicalType} logicalType logicalType
  134.  * @return {Object} JSON serializable object
  135.  */
  136. LogicalType.toJSON = function(logicalType) {
  137.   return {
  138.     logicalType_id: logicalType.logicalType_id,
  139.   };
  140. };
  142. /**
  143.  * Create a new argument type
  144.  * @param {Object} argumentType argumentType
  145.  * @param {string} type.argumentType_id argumentType_id
  146.  * @param {*} type.component this attribute will be used by the UI Framework adapter
  147.  * @return {object} ArgumentType
  148.  * @memberof dataclasses
  149.  */
  150. function ArgumentType(argumentType) {
  151.   // argumentType MUST at least have the properties bellow
  152.   const { argumentType_id, component } = _requireProps(
  153.     argumentType,
  154.     'argumentType_id,component'
  155.   );
  156.   return mergeAll([
  157.     $_type('ArgumentType'),
  158.     {
  159.       argumentType_id,
  160.       component,
  161.     },
  162.     argumentType,
  163.   ]);
  164. }
  166. const _toString = Object.prototype.toString;
  167. function _isObject(mixed) {
  168.   return _toString.call(mixed) === '[object Object]';
  169. }
  170. /**
  171.  * @param       {Object} object object
  172.  * @param       {string} properties comma-separated list of properties
  173.  * @return      {Object} the passed object
  174.  * @throws throw if a property is missing from the object
  175.  * @private
  176.  */
  177. function _requireProps(object, properties) {
  178.   if (!_isObject(object))
  179.     throw new Error(`Object is required, got: ${JSON.stringify(object)}.`);
  181.   const props = properties.split(',').map(trim);
  182.   let prop;
  184.   while ((prop = props.pop())) {
  185.     if (!object.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
  186.       throw new Error(
  187.         `Object ${JSON.stringify(object)} MUST have a '${prop}' property.`
  188.       );
  189.     }
  190.   }
  192.   return object;
  193. }
  195. module.exports = {
  196.   Type,
  197.   Target,
  198.   Operator,
  199.   LogicalType,
  200.   ArgumentType,
  201.   _requireProps,
  202. };
